name: Fabrício Benevenuto de Souza
content: Fabrício Benevenuto, Associate Professor, UFMG Fabrício Benevenuto Associate Professor (Professor Adjunto) Computer Science Department Federal University of Minas Gerais Room 7317  DCC - ICEx +55 31 3409-7598 fabricio (at) dcc (dot) ufmg (dot) br Bio I am associate professor in the Computer Science Department of Federal University at Minas Gerais (UFMG). I received a Ph.D. in Computer Science from UFMG, in 2010, and my thesis received the CAPES award as the best Brazilian thesis in computer science for that year. During my Ph.D., I held research intern positions at HP Labs (USA) and MPI-SWS (Max Planck Institute for Software Systems). Then, I worked for two years as assistant professor on Federal University of Ouro Preto (UFOP). I was elected an affiliated member of the Brazilian Academy of Science from 2013 to 2017 and, more recently, I received a prestigious scholarship from Humboldt foundation through which I was visiting faculty at MPI-SWS (2017-2018).  I am currently a member of the TikTok Safety Advisory Council. I am actively working on projects related to social media, including social computing, sentiment analysis, and computational journalism. My projects are usually interdisciplinary and involve areas from computer science related to data science, including complex networks, data mining, machine learning and natural language processing. Currently, I am leading a large project against Fake News. My work on these topics has led to a number of important publications, widely cited papers and systems with societal impact. I am keen to accept PhD., MSc. and undergrad students to work in topics that align with my research interests. Feel free to contact me about this to discuss possible topics of mutual interests. Systems and Applications Some of our papers are about novel systems. Eleições sem Fake: Many systems to provide transparency along the Brazilian elections and counter misinformation. Media Bias Monitor: We designed a system to quantify the political leaning of thousands of news outlets. Check our ICWSM18 paper for details. Purple Feed: Identifying High Consensus News Posts on Social Media. ScienceTree. Check your Academic Genealogical Tree. Who Makes Trends: Allow users to check demographics behind hashtags in Twitter. Ifeel: A sentiment analysis tool. You can label your dataset with the most important sentiment analysis methods. Cognos: Find experts in topics in Twitter. Who is who in Twitter.
